edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.frontend
Class MaximumIntensityProjection

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.frontend.MaximumIntensityProjection

public class MaximumIntensityProjection
extends java.lang.Object

Utilities for creating maximum intensity projections of images.

Author:
Colin J. Fuller

Constructor Summary
MaximumIntensityProjection()
           
 
Method Summary
static void project(java.lang.String filename)
          Makes a maximum intensity projection of an image designated by a given filename; writes the projection back out to disk in a subdirectory.
static void projectDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
          Makes maximum intensity projections of all the images in a single directory.
static Image projectImage(Image im)
          Makes a maximum intensity projection of an Image and returns it as an Image.

Method Detail

projectImage

public static Image projectImage(Image im)
Makes a maximum intensity projection of an Image and returns it as an Image.

Parameters:
im - The Image to be projected.
Returns:
The projection, as an Image.

project

public static void project(java.lang.String filename)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Makes a maximum intensity projection of an image designated by a given filename; writes the projection back out to disk in a subdirectory.

Parameters:
filename - The filename of the image to be projected.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem reading the image from disk or writing the projection to disk.

projectDirectory

public static void projectDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Makes maximum intensity projections of all the images in a single directory.

Parameters:
directory - The directory containing the images to project.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem reading the image from disk or writing the projection to disk.
